titles.title: 234 Long Have I Sought For Happiness (Jumps around

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Long have I sought for happiness
But where can it be found
Only dear Savior in Thy grace
Where purest joys abound

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
A moment's space without my God
Creates in me a hell
But when He sheds His love abroad
What raptures do I feel

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Lord if a transient sight of Thee
Affords us such a feast
How glorious will that vision be
Which shall forever last

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
When shall we Lord Thy glory see
In light without a shade
the glory which surrounded Thee
Before the world was made

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
What cares infirmities and pains
Oppress our feeble frame
Immortal health and vigor reign
In presence of the Lamb

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
We now but darkly thro' the glass
Behold the God we own
Then shall we see Him face to face
And know as we are known

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
Then Satan with his fiery darts
Shall us no more molest
His arrows cannot reach our hearts
When we in glory rest

verse.name: v8
verse.lines:
the world shall no more charm our eyes
Nor captivate our hearts
Our souls to nobler pleasures rise
Which God Himself imparts
